image.altText: A drone image showing the Aboriginal flag painted on a building roof.

props.synopsis: Nestled among the she-oak and banksia forest in Perth's north-east lies a once bustling Aboriginal community at risk of fading into obscurity.

title.children: 'We're still here': Aboriginal community in fight for survival decades after failed 'housing experiment'

image.altText: A man sits at a table wearing reading glasses and a white jacket as he looks over paper pages, looking concerned.

props.synopsis: As the rising cost of living continues to hit hard, Geraldton-based community legal service Regional Alliance West is being overwhelmed by the number of people seeking assistance.

title.children: 'Never seen this number of new people': Free legal service flooded by new clients hit by cost of living crisis

image.altText: A dump truck emptying a pile of red dirt into a very large mine - there are hills in the background.

props.synopsis: Plummeting iron ore prices on the back of China's cooling property market could cost the federal government $3 billion in revenue and push the budget further into deficit this financial year.

title.children: China's property crisis could wipe $3b from federal budget

image.altText: Fatima Payman in emerald green pant suit and matching hijab smiles, her husband in black pants and jacket has arm around her

props.synopsis: The inside story of why senator Fatima Payman broke ranks with the Labor Party and the fallout that followed in the capital and at home.

title.children: When Fatima Payman derailed her Labor career, the WA senator's husband was collateral damage

image.altText: A photo taken half underwater. A person is splashing into the blue water, while above trees and palms surround.

props.synopsis: There are fears that sacred, pristine sites are being put at risk by a government-backed push to grow cotton in the outback.

title.children: 'We're crying out for help': Pleas to save pristine outback oasis from drying up

image.altText: An old white man with a balding head speaks wearing a suit

props.synopsis: A government backbencher has spoken out against his party for gifting lobbyists more time to campaign on weaker gambling ad limits on TV and social media.

title.children: Labor slammed by own MP for giving gambling ad industry headstart on legislation

image.altText: composite picture of boy wearing an helmet and riding a steer

props.synopsis: Ex-bull rider Reece Wardlow acknowledges "life is dangerous" and believes the sport gives his son confidence.

title.children: This 10-year-old is riding bulls. His dad says he's a better kid for it

image.altText: A composite image of Imane Khelif and Raygun

props.synopsis: Two incidents — both involving women competing in the Olympics — provide the latest grim proof of the often toxic, menacing and deranged nature of social media. And it doesn't stop with those in the public eye.

title.children: We're entering a new phase of the social media wars

image.altText: Smoke and flames rise above a residential building after a strike.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian militant group has accused the Israeli prime minister of placing obstacles in the way of achieving an agreement.

title.children: Hamas rejects Gaza ceasefire deal, blaming Netanyahu for setting new 'obstacles'

image.altText: Zali Steggall gestures with her hand as she speaks passionately in parliament.

props.synopsis: The independent MP doubled down on her remarks about Peter Dutton, saying the opposition leader's "racist" Gaza visa ban needed to be called out. Follow live.

title.children: Zali Steggall says she doesn't regret telling Peter Dutton to 'stop being racist'

image.altText: A generic photograph of an unidentified WA Police officer wearing a high visibility police vest over a blue uniform.

props.synopsis: The three-year-old girl died last week after the car she was travelling in rolled over on an outback dirt road in WA's north.

title.children: Man charged with manslaughter after toddler dies in Pilbara car crash

image.altText: rows of books on a shelf

props.synopsis: The administrators of online book retailer Booktopia have confirmed they have secured a buyer for the troubled business.

title.children: Booktopia to begin trading again after sale to online store digiDirect

image.altText: Man surrounded by Gold confetti

props.synopsis: The Morning Show host Larry Emdur wins the award for the most popular person on Australian television. Here are some of the other key moments from the 64th Logie Awards.

title.children: Larry Emdur wins Gold Logie, Sam Pang lauded for his opening monologue and Raygun makes a surprise appearance

image.altText: A row of EV charging stations on a suburban road.

props.synopsis: Electric car sales are accelerating and along with it, additional demand for electricity. It's driving questions about how the grid will cope with the growing number of large batteries waiting to be charged.

title.children: Electric cars are booming as a wall of demand barrels towards the power grid. There are risks, but also opportunities

image.altText: A person's naked back with red marks on the skin all down the spine

props.synopsis: Spinal cord stimulators used by some pain specialists to treat chronic back pain are being slapped with conditions or cancelled by Australia's medical devices regulator amid a review into the safety and performance of the controversial products.

title.children: Some spinal cord stimulators cancelled by TGA amid calls to have the 'dangerous' devices banned

image.altText: A wide shot of the booking.com website on a laptop with a person sitting in front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland couple says people started arriving at their Sunshine Coast accommodation claiming to have made a reservation through Booking.com — but they had not listed the property on the platform.

title.children: Accommodation owners left feeling 'helpless' after groups arrive claiming to have booked only to be told it was a fake listing

image.altText: Black Caviar and her foal to Exceed And Excel

props.synopsis: When journalist Lucie Marr-Morris was invited to meet Black Caviar in retirement, she was shocked by the details of the champion mare's new life on a stud farm.

title.children: After an invitation to visit Black Caviar in retirement, the truth of her new life as a broodmare shocked me

image.altText: A large stage with a lit-up screen displaying 'DNC 2024'.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris has already been certified as the Democratic Party's candidate for president. So, the convention's real purpose will be to whip up support for her campaign in the hope it will motivate voters in November.

title.children: Kamala Harris heads to Chicago with hopes for a 'convention bounce'

image.altText: Black and white photo of woman in car without seatbelt

props.synopsis: Civil liberties advocates in Queensland remain concerned the cameras could capture nudity, underwear or private moments and are calling on the government to release the findings of two independent reviews into the privacy implications.

title.children: Call for mobile detection cam reviews to be made public amid fears drivers may be snapped in state of 'undress'

image.altText: A photo of the cornavirus.

props.synopsis: A new study finds that during September 2022, about 1.3 million Australians were living with long COVID and of that number about 55,000 were children aged four and under.

title.children: Long COVID has cost the Australian economy billions in lost work hours, new research says

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Wall Street's strong rebound didn't flow through to the ASX this morning as investors sweat on another batch of corporate results including Lend Lease's $1.5 billion loss. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slips despite Wall Street's positive lead as Lend Lease post $1.5bn loss and Booktopia rescued

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A2 Milk shares tumble despite profit lift
ASX opens marginally lower as results dominate the day
Ampol reports big jump in interim profit to $235 million

image.altText: A group of protesters holding signs demanding the closure of a controversial juvenile detention centre.

props.synopsis: The hearings into the death in custody of a 16-year-old Indigenous boy have revealed some shocking truths, but a lingering question remains for his family and others: What's the point of it all and can it lead to any meaningful change? WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Months of hearings in the Unit 18 coronial inquest will boil down to one simple question

image.altText: Katarzyna Niewiadoma wearing the leader's yellow jersey, with her arms raised, smiling, on the winner's podium

props.synopsis: Poland's Katarzyna Niewiadoma has won her first Tour de France Femmes title, fighting off the challenge of defending champion Demi Vollering on the Alpe d'Huez who won a dramatic final stage — but not by enough to retain her crown.

title.children: Niewiadoma fights off Vollering to win first Tour de France Femmes title

image.altText: Soldier moves a ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft cannon

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenskyy had previously said the operation aimed to protect communities in the bordering Sumy region from constant shelling.

title.children: Ukraine's push into Russia's Kursk region aims to 'create buffer zone'

image.altText: Belinda Kerwin in hospital after being diagnosed with bowel cancer in June last year.

props.synopsis: When Belinda Kerwin, a bowel cancer screening nurse, developed symptoms herself she initially dismissed them, thinking she was too young.

title.children: A bowel cancer screening nurse dismissed her symptoms.  Turns out, she had the disease

image.altText: Two little girls hold up books while sitting on chairs next to each other while a pink dollhouse in the background..

props.synopsis: The screening program, developed in the UK, can be used on children as young as 3 to identify issues with language and literacy — and it's "easy and relaxed" according to one of the teachers involved in the trial.

title.children: This school is trialling a new program to help turn around falling reading results

image.altText: Elly-May Barnes, Kumi Taguchi, Robert Irwin and Julia Morris on the red carpet

props.synopsis: Here are some of the bold and bright looks we saw on the red carpet for the 2024 Logies.

title.children: Logies red carpet: Check out the best fashion from TV's big night

image.altText: Two children lean over a tap holding plastic cans for water, one looks sadly at the camera

props.synopsis: Polio, once eradicated thanks to almost all children in Gaza being vaccinated, has been detected again in the occupied territory.

title.children: A nearly eradicated disease has re-emerged in Gaza. What happens next?

image.altText: Two young boys in dark coloured tshirts sit in black gaming chairs, playing computer games. One is wearing a black headset.

props.synopsis: Geraldton mother Alicia Kimberley has always struggled to find social activities for her son Corbin, who has autism. But now he's "thriving" thanks to weekly gaming sessions at The Zone.

title.children: 'A sense of belonging': The gaming zone helping neurodivergent kids connect

image.altText: Photo illustration of Sydney Metro train with teal background and teal and white M sign in top left corner

props.synopsis: The transport project expected to reshape the future of Sydneysiders move around is set to open soon. This is what you need to know.

title.children: Sydney Metro promises to reshape the city. Here's how it'll affect you

image.altText: White man with grey hair wearing white shirt and suit jacket slightly leans forward and poses for camera

props.synopsis: Alain Delon shot to fame in two films by Italian director Luchino Visconti, Rocco and His Brothers in 1960 and The Leopard in 1963.

title.children: French movie giant Alain Delon dies aged 88

image.altText: A screenshot of the new ABC News website.

props.synopsis: Welcome to the fresh ABC NEWS website. We're excited you're here. Let's take a tour through what's different and why we're changing.

title.children: ABC NEWS unveils new-look website and app
